{include "default_salutation"} –

Tuesday, the New Hampshire Senate's Judiciary Committee is hearing two bills that directly attack abortion access in New Hampshire. These dangerous bills, HB 625 and HB 233, have already passed the NH House, making Tuesday's hearing the last one before the full NH Senate will vote on the bills.

Let's make it clear that we are telling our senators to prioritize the health and safety of Granite Staters by opposing HB 625 and HB 233.

Will you take a moment right now to virtually sign in opposition to each bill before tomorrow's hearing?

Here's how – it only takes a minute:

  • Visit the State Senate's remote sign-in website, and select March 30.
  • Select Senate Judiciary.
  • Choose bill – either HB 625 or HB 233 (you will need to sign in against each one individually).
  • Select "member of the public" if you are just representing yourself, and click "I oppose this bill." Leave the checkbox under "Testify" blank unless you wish to testify at the hearing.

Here's what each bill would do if enacted:

HB 625 would ban abortion later in pregnancy, and criminalize doctors with up to seven years in prison. A person's health and wellbeing should be a conversation between them and their doctor – not politicians.

HB 233 would interfere with families' decisions about compassionate, often heartbreaking, end-of-life care. This bill would threaten parents' ability to decide what type of compassionate care is best for their child and family, and would cause additional pain and suffering to families whose infant has severe health conditions and only hours or days to live.

Remember: you can sign in opposition until 8 a.m. Tuesday morning.

Thank you for your support, and for your solidarity in the fight to protect reproductive rights in New Hampshire.

Sincerely,
